asset_browser.title: Asset Browser
asset_browser.no_assets: No assets in this list yet

object_editor.tt_sprite:
Which drawing this object should display when placed in the level.
If no drawing is selected, the object will use a placeholder in the editor, and be invisible in game.
object_editor.tt_start_frame: The frame which the animation will start on
object_editor.tt_fps:
How many animation frames should play each second.
Higher number means the animation will be faster
object_editor.tt_loop:
Toggles whether or not the animation should loop when it's played.
If off, animation will freeze on the last frame
object_editor.tt_solid: Toggles whether or not other objects will react to colliding with this object
object_editor.tt_gravity: Toggles whether or not this object is affected by the room's gravity
object_editor.tt_trigger_exits: Toggles whether or not the object should trigger a room change when it collides with an exit
object_editor.tt_logic_type: Choose to use a logic preset, or a custom logic script
object_editor.tt_logic_preset: Select what type of logic preset this object should use
object_editor.tt_groups:
Add custom groups this object should belong to.
Can be used when scripting to get different objects which have the same group

room_editor.no_room_selected: Add a room, and select it to start editing
room_editor.tt_inst_name: Unique name for this instance of an object
room_editor.tt_coll_ovr:
Change the collision type for this instance only.
"Keep" will keep the original object's value
room_editor.tt_cust_depth:
Change what order this instance is drawn on top of others.
Higher number = On Top
room_editor.tt_cust_inst_vars:
Add custom variables to this instance.
These can be read in the Logic to make this instance unique.
room_editor.tt_cust_room_vars:
Add custom variables to this room.
These can be read in the Logic to make this room unique.
room_editor.tt_camera_size:
Sets the "Zoom" of the camera.
Larger number means more things on screen
room_editor.tt_camera_move:
Set what type of motion the camera has.
Locked: Camera is still
Follow: Camera follows an object
Scroll: Camera scrolls at a constant rate in the chosen direction
room_editor.tt_camera_scroll_dir: Set which direction the camera should scroll in
room_editor.tt_camera_scroll_speed: Set the speed that the camera will scroll
room_editor.tt_camera_follow_obj: Select which object the camera should follow
room_editor.tt_camera_follow_type:
Select style of motion the camera should use when following an object.
Smooth: Object will always be near center of screen
Tiled: Object must reach edge of screen before camera moves
room_editor.tt_exit_trans: Style of transition to use when switching rooms
room_editor.tt_exit_is_ending:
Toggle if exit ends game or not.
Endings display the ending dialog when triggered
room_editor.tt_exit_dest_room: Select the room which the exit will lead to
room_editor.tt_exit_dest_exit: Select the specific exit that this one will lead to
room_editor.tt_exit_end_dialog: This text will be displayed on screen after the exit is triggered
room_editor.tt_exit_delete: Deletes the exit from the room
room_editor.tt_room_background: Change the background color of the room
room_editor.tt_room_persist:
Keep any changes made to this room while playing.
Objects that are added, changed, or removed will keep changes when you leave and return to this room.
WARNING: These changes will only stick around while the game is running, and will not be saved if the player closes the game
room_editor.tt_room_use_gravity: Turn gravity on or off for this room.
room_editor.tt_room_gravity: Set how strong the gravity is in this room
room_editor.tt_room_starting_room: Set this room to load when the game starts
